inclusion.criterion: with clinically evident AECOPD and in need for mechanical ventilation confirmed by arterial blood gases (ABGs)
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Excluded Patients from the study were those who were not enrolled within the first 24 hours of mechanical ventilation and those who were likely to be extubated within 24 hours.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: History of pulmonary bleeding within the previous 3 months
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Known to be allergic to heparin or History of thrombocytopenia after previous treatment with heparin.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Female patients were excluded if they were pregnant or breast feeding.
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient A is a 30-year-old male who was admitted to the hospital after 10 days of cough, profuse nocturnal sweating and loss of appetite. He had traveled to India 1 months ago and has not any positive history of TB vaccination.
